intent_analysis:
Intent: Turn off all devices that are currently on, including the two meross-Light-Strips and both Samsung TVs.  
Signals: The command "Abhisek: Turn it off" suggests a desire to power down devices, with a preference indicating the TV may be the target.  
Risk: None; all devices listed can be turned off using the switch capability.
environment_overview:
1) The detected devices include a c2c-switch, two meross-Light-Strips, and two Samsung TVs. The c2c-switch is identified with the capability to switch on and off, while the meross-Light-Strips have additional capabilities such as color control and brightness adjustment. The Samsung TVs, specifically the Samsung The Frame and Samsung 8 Series, are also equipped with switching capabilities, indicating they can be powered on or off remotely.

2) The current state of the c2c-switch is off, indicating it is already powered down. The first meross-Light-Strip is set to a brightness level of 70, while the second is at 48, both of which can be adjusted or turned off using their switch capabilities. The Samsung TVs are currently on, and they can be turned off using the switch command. If audio is playing, the audioMute capability can be employed to silence them. The actionable controls for these devices primarily involve switching them off or adjusting their brightness levels.
